e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (23:35): feels he can add simple and effective render tree manipulation with a handful of new CSS attributes and perhaps a few pseudo-selectors. This should really ease the pain of Web dev who now have to weave these shims and wrappers in markup or with JS.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:36): this is an area where we have to make sure we do things the right way, because there are a huge number of subtlties that make things rather complicated
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (23:36): did hyatt invent the adoption agency algorithm, too?

e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (23:39): really, honestly -- I am not pursuing counters, quotations, named string, and such. I just want wrap,insert before, after, and move to. I'll go think on this.
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (23:40): + clipboard interaction
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (23:40): + dom/selector effects
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:41): well insert before and after you can do now with ::before/::after
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:41): wrap would be ::inside, right?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:41): the move-to mechanism in the css3 content draft has more holes in it than a french gruyere
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (23:42): mmm... cheese
